docs.lead_paragraph: Whether governments can be trusted to do what they say they will do is the question that will determine whether a Paris climate change accord has teeth.

byline.contributor: Justin Gillis contributed reporting from Paris.

docs.snippet: Whether governments can be trusted to do what they say they will do is the question that will determine whether a Paris climate change accord has teeth....
docs.abstract: New Analysis; World leaders enter final week of United Nations sponsored climate change negotiations in France; face impasse over monitoring transparency and annual funding of $100 billion to help poor countries convert to environmentally favorable energy solutions.

headline.main: Trust and Money at Core of Crucial Paris Talks on Climate Change
headline.print_headline: Pledges on Climate Will Be Useless Without Action and Funding

docs.lead_paragraph:
TOWNSEND--Eleanor

Meneely, M.D., a psychiatrist in New York City died at her home December 2nd, age 83. A retired member of the faculty of Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons she was associated with both Presbyterian and Harlem Hospitals and for many years was director of The Harlem Center for Child Study. She attended The Brearley School and was a graduate of Sarah Lawrence College and Columbia University P&S. She was a psychiatry consultant for various institutions including Prisoners Legal Services. She was the daughter of Clinton Blake and Eleanor Meneely Townsend. She is survived by her husband of 53 years, Monroe Chasson and her daughters, Kate Chasson of Winter Park, CO and Sarah Chasson of Chevy Chase, MD, Frank G. Zarb, Jr, three grandchildren, and her brother Clinton (Bill) Townsend of Canaan, ME.

docs.lead_paragraph: In interviews, speeches and in stealthier ways, Mr. Rubio has abruptly changed the course of his campaign to zero in on Mr. Cruz and reverse his gains among conservative voters.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and JEREMY W. PETERS

docs.snippet: In interviews, speeches and in stealthier ways, Mr. Rubio has abruptly changed the course of his campaign to zero in on Mr. Cruz and reverse his gains among conservative voters....
docs.abstract: Sen Marco Rubio has abandoned his previous strategy of trying to stay above fray in Republican presidential primary and has started questioning qualifications of Sen Ted Cruz in attempt to stall Cruz's momentum in Iowa among conservative voters; Rubio's campaign as well as allied political group have focused on trying to paint Cruz as weak on national security and to raise questions about his stance on illegal immigration.

headline.print_headline: Rubio Changes Tactics, Aiming at a Rising Cruz
headline.main: Marco Rubio, Switching Focus, Aims to Halt Ted Cruz’s Momentum
